IX.	Emergency Communications
The telephone numbers of agencies and plant personnel that may be contacted in case of an emergency are available onsite.
 

X.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Chemical safety is an important part of Hearthside operations. Hearthside is currently implementing their Process Safety Management Program. Continuous improvement in safety is an important goal for Hearthside.  

XI.	Management Program
Hearthside has updated a management system to oversee the implementation of the risk management program elements.  This system has assigned qualified person(s) (or position) to assist in the development, implementation, and integration of the risk management program elements.  If any portion of the program is delegated to others, the names or positions of those individuals will be documented and the lines of authority defined through an organization chart or similar document.  Currently, Gary Home, Refrigeration Engineer, is responsible for implementation of the overall Risk Management Program.

	Compliance Audit - Hearthside has developed a site-specific compliance audit program that ensures compliance audits are conducted at a minimum of every three years to verify that Hearthside PSM/RMP practices and procedures are adequate and are being followed. The next compliance audit will be conducted by March 31, 2025.  
	Hot Work Permits - Hearthside has developed a best management practice for hot work.  Hearthside's hot work permit procedures for the refrigeration system were reviewed on March 31, 2022.
 

VII.	Five-Year Accident History
The Hearthside facility has not experienced an accidental anhydrous ammonia release, which resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage onsite, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

VIII.	Emergency Action Program
Hearthside has developed an Emergency Action Plan (ERP) to ensure that in the event of an emergency the facility personnel are aware of the appropriate actions to take and authorities to contact in order to mitigate the effects of a release. 

Hearthside has conducted emergency drills as a training tool to provide employees proper evacuation procedures and has interacted (i.e. onsite meetings) with the Carol Stream Fire Department. 

Hearthside has coordinated their ERP with the Carol Stream Fire Department. The elements of the PSM / Program 3 prevention program and a brief description are listed below.
 
	Employee Participation - Hearthside has developed a site-specific employee participation plan that ensures employees and their representatives are consulted when conducting and developing process hazard analyses and other information required to be developed under the PSM/RMP regulation.  In addition, the employee participation program will ensure employees and their representatives have access to process hazard analyses and all other information required to be developed under PSM/RMP.

	Process Hazard Analysis - Hearthside has developed a site-specific PHA program that ensured a PHA was conducted initially, at a minimum of every five (5) years, and whenever a change is significant enough to require a change in PSI. III.	Facility Identification
The Hearthside facility is located at 720 Center Street in Carol Stream, Illinois.  Hearthside is a contract food packaging and co-manufacturing facility that provides manufacturing / processing support, secondary packaging and shipping to suppliers and distribution centers. 

The NAICS code for the facility is 31199.  A large portion of the facility is refrigerated to preserve products for packaging and distribution.   

The facility uses ammonia for refrigeration, and is regulated under 40 CFR Part 68, the EPA RMP Rule. There is one (1) refrigeration system onsite that is used for refrigerating coolers and freezers throughout the facility. 

The amount of ammonia currently onsite has been estimated at approximately 28,000 pounds.  The refrigeration system is used to cool freezers, coolers, production rooms, and docks.  This refrigeration system uses ammonia refrigerant in a two (2) stage evaporation/condensation cycle.    

An aerial map identifying the site location is included as Appendix A. 

IV.	Hazard Assessment - Worse Case Scenarios (WCS)
Appendix B consists of the RMP*Submit Printout and contains additional information on the worst-case scenario.  Appendix C consists of the offsite consequence analysis data and maps for the worse case release scenario. 

Hazard Assessment - Alternative Release Scenarios (ARS)
Appendix B consists of the RMP*Submit Printout and contains additional information on the alternative release scenario.  Appendix D consists of the offsite consequence analysis data and maps for the alternative release scenario.
